Interface BoardInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Board

    public interface BoardInterface
    This interface is used to define how an instance of a Board can be communicated with. DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    Version:
    0.1.1
    Author:
    Stephen McGough

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Piece gameWon()
      Checks to see if either player has won.
      Piece[][] getBoardView()
      This method will return a two dimentional array of Pieces which represents the current state of the board.
      boolean placePiece(Piece colour, MoveInterface move)
      Places a piece on the board at the specified location.
      boolean setBoardSize(int sizeX, int sizeY)
      Specifiy the size of the board that we are playing on.

    • Method Detail

      • setBoardSize

        boolean setBoardSize(int sizeX,
                     int sizeY)
              throws InvalidBoardSizeException,
                     BoardAlreadySizedException
        Specifiy the size of the board that we are playing on. Both numbers must be greater than zero
        Parameters:
        sizeX - how wide the board will be
        sizeY - how tall the board will be
        Throws:
        InvalidBoardSizeException - If either size value is less than one.
        BoardAlreadySizedException - If the board has already been created.

      • getBoardView

        Piece[][] getBoardView()
                throws NoBoardDefinedException
        This method will return a two dimentional array of Pieces which represents the current state of the board. As this is just a copy of the data it is safe to send to a Player.
        Throws:
        NoBoardDefinedException - Thrown when a call is made to this method before the boardSize method.

      • placePiece

        boolean placePiece(Piece colour,
                   MoveInterface move)
            throws PositionAlreadyTakenException,
                   InvalidPositionException,
                   InvalidColourException,
                   NoBoardDefinedException
        Places a piece on the board at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        colour - the colour of the piece to place (RED or BLUE)
        move - the position where you wish to place a piece
        Returns:
        boolean true if the piece was placed successfully
        Throws:
        PositionAlreadyTakenException - if there is already a Piece in this position
        InvalidPositionException - if the specified position is invalid - e.g. (-1, -1)
        InvalidColourException - if the colour being set is invalid. E.g. if you try to place two BLUE pieces one after the other
        NoBoardDefinedException - if the board has yet to be defined with setBoardSize()

      • gameWon

        Piece gameWon()
       throws NoBoardDefinedException
        Checks to see if either player has won.
        Returns:
        Piece RED if red has won, BLUE if blue has won, UNSET if neither player has won.
        Throws:
        NoBoardDefinedException - Indicates that this method has been called before the boardSize method
